articles.title: Authorities say a student is dead after shooting 2 peers and then himself at Colorado high school
articles.description:
A student shot two of his peers Wednesday at a suburban Denver high school before shooting himself and later dying, authorities said

The post Authorities say a student is dead after shooting 2 peers and then himself at Colorado high school appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: A student shot two peers and then himself at a Colorado high school.
The incident occurred on Wednesday, resulting in one death and two injuries.
Boston schools may increase security measures in response to rising concerns about school shootings.

articles.title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
articles.description:
"It’s not like he took that next step from his rookie year into his second year."

The post Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye's performance against the Raiders on September 10.
Gronkowski noted Maye appeared ‘timid’ in his second NFL season.
Fans express concern over Maye's development impacting the Patriots' season outlook.

articles.title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
articles.description:
The man, who suffered life-threatening injuries when he was hit by an e-bike in August, has died, according to police.

The post Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Braintree man dies on September 10 after e-bike accident in Copley Square.
The man suffered life-threatening injuries from the incident in August.
This incident raises concerns about e-bike safety in busy Boston areas.

articles.title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
articles.description:
The tides are scientifically known as perigean spring tides and are caused by a combination of the moon’s orbit and phases.

The post Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Expect 'wicked high' king tides at Boston Harbor this week due to perigean spring tides.
Tides are influenced by the moon's orbit and phases, affecting local waterfront areas.
Residents should prepare for potential flooding and increased water levels in coastal neighborhoods.
